verses.kjv: Now will I sing to my wellbeloved a song of my beloved touching his vineyard. My wellbeloved hath a vineyard in a very fruitful hill:
verses.ct: Let me sing a song for the one I love — a song about his vineyard. The one I love had a vineyard on a rich, fertile hillside.

verses.kjv: And he fenced it, and gathered out the stones thereof, and planted it with the choicest vine, and built a tower in the midst of it, and also made a winepress therein: and he looked that it should bring forth grapes, and it brought forth wild grapes.
verses.ct: He dug it up, cleared away the rocks, and planted it with the finest vines. He built a watchtower in the middle of it and carved out a winepress as well. He expected it to produce good grapes, but it only produced worthless ones.

verses.kjv: And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem, and men of Judah, judge, I pray you, betwixt me and my vineyard.
verses.ct: "So now, people of Jerusalem and citizens of Judah, I ask you to decide between me and my vineyard.

verses.kjv: What could have been done more to my vineyard, that I have not done in it? wherefore, when I looked that it should bring forth grapes, brought it forth wild grapes?
verses.ct: What more could I have done for my vineyard that I didn't already do? Why did it produce worthless grapes when I expected good ones?

verses.kjv: And now go to; I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard: I will take away the hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up; and break down the wall thereof, and it shall be trodden down:
verses.ct: Now let me tell you what I'm going to do to my vineyard: I will remove its protective hedge so it will be devoured, and I will tear down its wall so it will be trampled.

verses.kjv: And I will lay it waste: it shall not be pruned, nor digged; but there shall come up briers and thorns: I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.
verses.ct: I will turn it into a wasteland. It won't be pruned or cultivated, and thorns and briers will take it over. I will even order the clouds to withhold their rain from it."

verses.kjv: For the vineyard of the LORD of hosts is the house of Israel, and the men of Judah his pleasant plant: and he looked for judgment, but behold oppression; for righteousness, but behold a cry.
verses.ct: The vineyard of the LORD of hosts is the nation of Israel, and the people of Judah are the garden he delighted in. He hoped for justice, but instead found oppression; he hoped for righteousness, but instead heard cries of distress.

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that join house to house, that lay field to field, till there be no place, that they may be placed alone in the midst of the earth!
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for those who buy up house after house and acquire field after field until there's no room left, and they live alone in the middle of the land!

verses.kjv: In mine ears said the LORD of hosts, Of a truth many houses shall be desolate, even great and fair, without inhabitant.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts declared in my hearing, "Without a doubt, many houses will stand empty — even large, beautiful ones will have no one living in them.

verses.kjv: Yea, ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, and the seed of an homer shall yield an ephah.
verses.ct: 10 acres of vineyard will produce only 6 gallons of wine, and 6 bushels of seed will yield barely half a bushel of grain."

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that rise up early in the morning, that they may follow strong drink; that continue until night, till wine inflame them!
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for those who get up early in the morning chasing alcohol, who stay up late into the night until wine consumes them!

verses.kjv: And the harp, and the viol, the tabret, and pipe, and wine, are in their feasts: but they regard not the work of the LORD, neither consider the operation of his hands.
verses.ct: They have harps and lyres, tambourines and flutes and wine at their parties, but they pay no attention to what the LORD is doing and never notice the work of his hands.

verses.kjv: Therefore my people are gone into captivity, because they have no knowledge: and their honourable men are famished, and their multitude dried up with thirst.
verses.ct: Because of this, my people will go into exile due to their lack of understanding. Their honored leaders will starve, and the common people will be parched with thirst.

verses.kjv: Therefore hell hath enlarged herself, and opened her mouth without measure: and their glory, and their multitude, and their pomp, and he that rejoiceth, shall descend into it.
verses.ct: So the grave has expanded its appetite and opened its mouth beyond all limits. Down into it will go their splendor, their crowds, their noise, and everyone who celebrates among them.

verses.kjv: And the mean man shall be brought down, and the mighty man shall be humbled, and the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled:
verses.ct: Ordinary people will be brought low, the powerful will be humbled, and the arrogant will have their pride crushed.

verses.kjv: But the LORD of hosts shall be exalted in judgment, and God that is holy shall be sanctified in righteousness.
verses.ct: But the LORD of hosts will be lifted high through justice, and the holy God will demonstrate his holiness through righteousness.

verses.kjv: Then shall the lambs feed after their manner, and the waste places of the fat ones shall strangers eat.
verses.ct: Then lambs will graze as if in their own pasture, and outsiders will feed among the ruins of the wealthy.

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope:
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for those who drag sin along with ropes of deception, who haul wickedness behind them like a cart on a rope,

verses.kjv: That say, Let him make speed, and hasten his work, that we may see it: and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw nigh and come, that we may know it!
verses.ct: who say, "Let God hurry up and act so we can see it! Let the plan of the Holy One of Israel come closer and happen, so we can find out what it is!"

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that call evil good, and good evil; that put darkness for light, and light for darkness; that put bitter for sweet, and sweet for bitter!
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for those who call evil good and good evil, who substitute darkness for light and light for darkness, who trade bitter for sweet and sweet for bitter!

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that are wise in their own eyes, and prudent in their own sight!
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for those who consider themselves wise and think they are so clever!

verses.kjv: Woe unto them that are mighty to drink wine, and men of strength to mingle strong drink:
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for those who are champions at drinking wine and experts at mixing strong drinks,

verses.kjv: Which justify the wicked for reward, and take away the righteousness of the righteous from him!
verses.ct: who let the guilty go free in exchange for bribes and strip the innocent of their righteousness!

verses.kjv: Therefore as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, so their root shall be as rottenness, and their blossom shall go up as dust: because they have cast away the law of the LORD of hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: So just as fire burns up straw and dry grass shrivels in the flame, their roots will rot and their blossoms will blow away like dust — because they rejected the law of the LORD of hosts and treated the word of the Holy One of Israel with contempt.

verses.kjv: Therefore is the anger of the LORD kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them: and the hills did tremble, and their carcases were torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.ct: That is why the LORD's anger burns against his people. He raised his hand against them and struck them down. The mountains trembled, and dead bodies lay like garbage in the streets. Even after all this, his anger has not subsided, and his hand is still raised to strike.

verses.kjv: And he will lift up an ensign to the nations from far, and will hiss unto them from the end of the earth: and, behold, they shall come with speed swiftly:
verses.ct: He will raise a signal flag for distant nations and whistle for them from the ends of the earth. Watch — they will come racing in at incredible speed!

verses.kjv: None shall be weary nor stumble among them; none shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the latchet of their shoes be broken:
verses.ct: Not one of them will grow tired or stumble. None will doze off or fall asleep. Every belt will stay fastened tight, and not a single sandal strap will break.

verses.kjv: Whose arrows are sharp, and all their bows bent, their horses’ hoofs shall be counted like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind:
verses.ct: Their arrows are razor-sharp, and every bow is strung and ready. Their horses' hooves are as hard as flint, and their chariot wheels spin like a whirlwind.

verses.kjv: Their roaring shall be like a lion, they shall roar like young lions: yea, they shall roar, and lay hold of the prey, and shall carry it away safe, and none shall deliver it.
verses.ct: Their battle cry is like a lion's roar — they roar like young lions. They growl as they seize their prey and carry it off, and no one can rescue it from them.

verses.kjv: And in that day they shall roar against them like the roaring of the sea: and if one look unto the land, behold darkness and sorrow, and the light is darkened in the heavens thereof.
verses.ct: On that day they will roar over Israel like the roaring of the sea. If anyone looks out over the land, there will be only darkness and distress, and the light will be blocked out by thick clouds.
